revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Pelvic Plexus and Nervus Collector in Mustelus and M. vulpis
tldr: The authors investigate the formation of the pelvic plexus and the nervus collector in Mustelus and M. vulpis, examining the anatomical variations and embryonic development of these structures. They find that the nervus collector is composed of branches from five nerves, with variations in the size and structure of these branches between species and developmental stages.
